intro: Allophylus amplissimus, commonly known as the large-leafed alder, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. Allophylus amplissimus is often found in moist, well-drained soils near streams or in dense forests.
